free: #e I am going to tell a story about pears.
#c 我要說一個跟梨子有關的故事。
#e There is an old man working in the field, planting pears.
#c 有一位老人在旱田工作，（就是）種梨子。
#e When pears grow big, that old man goes to pick them up.
#c 梨子長大時，老人就去摘。
#n nasi (日文借字；梨子)
#e He goes to climb... there is a ladder that he brought there. Then, he climbs up the mountain to get pears and put them on the front.
#c 他去爬... 他有拿梯子，然後他爬山去拿梨子，放在胸前那裡。
#n what the narrator mentioned should be tree, not mountain. 說話者指的應該是樹不是山。
#e At that time, that old man... three baskets... carries three baskets to hold pears.
#c 那時候那個老人... 三個籃子... 帶三個籃子放梨子。
#e That old man is picking up pears above.
#c 那個老人正在上面採梨子。
#n baki 和 rudan 皆為對年長者之尊稱。前者專指男性長輩，祖父輩以上，可無血緣關係。
#e Then there passed a person, a young boy.
#c 然後那邊經過一個人。一個年輕男子經過。
#n riso (年輕男子，高中以上)；weewa (年輕女子，高中以上)；皆可為年紀相對說法。
#e he carries... leads a sheep.
#c 他牽... 帶領叫做羊的。
#n madis (攜帶)，dmudun (帶領)
#n miric (有人飼養的羊)
#e He does not see the old man that is picking up pears in the tree.
#c 然後他沒看到在樹上採梨子的老人。
#e He goes... he passes there without speaking (to the old man).
#c 他去... 他經過那裡也沒有說話。
#n asi 有 "立刻" 、 "直接" 的語意。緊接的動詞主焦以詞根形式出現，非主焦則以非實現貌形式出現。
#e After that, in a short while, a boy passes by.
#c 後來不久之後，男孩經過。
#e (He) rides a bike... a small bike.
#c 他騎腳踏車... 小的腳踏車。
#n rulu (四輪車；非腳踏車；但此處意指為腳踏車)。
#n biciq (體積小；年紀小)。
#e Then he also does not see the old man who is picking up pears.
#c 然後他也沒看採梨子的老人。
#e But that child sees his basket full of pears. That child wants to take pears, and observe if there is anyone else here. He still does not see the old man above.
#c 但是那個小孩看有許多梨子的籃子，然後想要拿梨子，看旁邊有沒有人，然後他沒有看到老人在上面。
#n ani si 'however 但是'
#e Therefore, he takes... takes one pear basket and puts it on his bike. Then that child leaves.
#c 所以他帶... 帶一個梨子籃,然後放在他的腳踏車，然後那個小孩離開了。
#e Then in a short while, that boy leaves. A girl comes up.
#c 然後不久之後，男孩離開了。中途女孩過來那邊。
#e The girl is getting closer, and that boy looks at the girl over his shoulder.
#c 女孩靠過來，然後那個男孩看背後看女孩。
#n  anu ka (因為)
#e When that boy sees the girl in that way, quickly... When the girl leaves, he bumps into something.
#c 那個男孩看女孩的時候... 那?樣地很快地... 那個女孩離開的時候,他撞到。
#n ptatuk should be ptebuk./ ptabuk應該是ptebuk.
#e The wind blows and... what does it call? His hat, and his hat fallss down on the road.
#c 然後風吹... 那個叫什?的... 他的帽子... 然後他的帽子掉路上了。
#e While he looks back over his shoulder, he does not know that there is a stone in his front.
#c 還在看背後的時候,他不知道前面路上有石頭。
#n oda 為 "經過" 之詞根。依情境可譯為 "經驗" 、 "道路" 等語意。
#e Then his bike bumps into a stone.
#c 然後他的腳踏車撞到石頭。
#e Then his bike falls down and so does he.
#c 然後他的腳踏車跌倒，他也跌倒。
#e All the pears that are taken away fall onto the ground. All the pears taken get scattered on the ground.
#c 拿過的所有的梨子摔到地上。拿過的所有的梨子翻落在地上。
#e perhaps that.. this boy hurts his foot, so he does not get up soon.
#c 也許那個... 這個男孩腳受傷,沒有馬上起來。
#e In a short while, three boys come close, and then they look (at him).
#c 不久之後三個小孩過來... 山上... 小孩... 三個男孩.然後他們看到（他）。
#e It seems that that child's foot hurts. They approach him and have sympathy with him, thinking "let's help (him)".
#c 然後那個小孩好像腳痛。他們靠過來想說「我們幫忙吧。」
#n meyah lnlungan 發善心；起了同情心
#e So the children help him.
#c 所以小孩們幫忙... 三個小孩(幫忙)。
#e one... two children help him. Then one child does not offer help, and he is just patting his ball alone.
#c 一個... 兩個小孩幫忙，然後一個沒有幫忙.他自己拍拍他的球。

gloss: 繩子掛在頭額上,藤籃子背後面.
free: #e The one (does not help him.) Then the other two help him pick up all of his pears and put them in the basket.
#c 一個（沒幫忙）。然後兩個幫忙檢他所有的梨子然後放在籃子裡。
#n bruru refers to women's basket. A rope is hung around front and rattan basket is placed in the back. Bruru為女
#e They put the pears in the basket, and then raise that child up.
#c 放在籃子裡，然後把那個小孩扶起來。
#e Also they help to raise the bike too.
#c 他們又幫忙把腳踏車扶起來。
#e Then they help that child put all of his pears on the bike.
#c 然後他們幫那個小孩把他所有的梨子放在腳踏車上。
#e Then, that child who just falls does not say "thank you" either.
#c 然後那個跌倒的小孩也沒有說謝謝。
#n mhue (謝謝)；mhue su bale (wa) (真的很感謝你；對話時)
#e The three children leave.
#c 然後那三個小孩離開了。
#e Then that child who just falls leaves by himself... placing the bike by himself... and leaving by himself.
#c 然後跌倒的那個男孩自己離開了... 他自己把腳踏車放好... 自己離開了。
#e Then not walking too far, the three boys see his hat in the middle of the road.
#c 然後他們路走不遠，那三個男孩在路中間看到他的帽子。
#e "Bunuh" is called "bosi" in Japanese.
#c 'bunuh'用日語稱為'bosi'.
#e Seeing his hat on the road, they take his hat and say "wee!".
#c 看到他的帽子在路中間，然後他們撿起來說「wee!」。
#n we =ge
#e He says "is this your hat?".
#c 他說「這是你的帽子嗎?」
#e Then the boy who rides the bike looks back at the hat, and says "my hat".
#c 然後騎腳踏車的男孩看背後... 然後帽子然後... 說「我的帽子。」
#e They send the boy his hat. The boy seems to say "thank you very much for returning me the hat.". Then he gives three pears to them.
#c 然後他們送他的帽子給那個男孩。那個男孩好像說你們心地真好給我帽子。 他是這麼樣的，他拿三個梨子送給他們。
#e They are happy too.
#c 他們也很高興。
#e Then they leave. In a short while, and so does the boy who rides the bike. Then these three boys arrive at the tree... pear tree root there.
#c 然後他們離開了，不久之後騎腳踏車的男孩也離開了。然後這三個男孩到達樹根... 到達梨子樹。
#n taapa rulu (搭車，不是開車；此處為騎(兩輪)車/馬；開(四輪)車mgeriq)
